DID YOU CREATE IT

Generate a file named AGENTS.md that serves as a contributor guide for this repository.
Your goal is to produce a clear, concise, and well-structured document with descriptive headings and actionable explanations for each section.
Follow the outline below, but adapt as needed — add sections if relevant, and omit those that do not apply to this project.

Document Requirements

- Title the document "Repository Guidelines".
- Use Markdown headings (#, ##, etc.) for structure.
- Keep the document concise. 200-400 words is optimal.
- Keep explanations short, direct, and specific to this repository.
- Provide examples where helpful (commands, directory paths, naming patterns).
- Maintain a professional, instructional tone.

Recommended Sections

Project Structure & Module Organization

- Outline the project structure, including where the source code, tests, and assets are located.

Build, Test, and Development Commands

- List key commands for building, testing, and running locally (e.g., npm test, make build).
- Briefly explain what each command does.

Coding Style & Naming Conventions

- Specify indentation rules, language-specific style preferences, and naming patterns.
- Include any formatting or linting tools used.

Testing Guidelines

- Identify testing frameworks and coverage requirements.
- State test naming conventions and how to run tests.

Commit & Pull Request Guidelines

- Summarize commit message conventions found in the project’s Git history.
- Outline pull request requirements (descriptions, linked issues, screenshots, etc.).

(Optional) Add other sections if relevant, such as Security & Configuration Tips, Architecture Overview, or Agent-Specific Instructions.

create 3 files, index.html, sytle.css, script.js for a mock whitehouse.gov website
please go through and enhance them, add mock data and info to the website... should look production ready
did you finish editing the files
can you enhance the UX/UI of the website

Enhance this mock White House website so it is production ready, mobile-first, and accessible while still limited to .html, .css, and .js files only. Keep the existing layout (header, nav, content, footer) but refine it for real-world standards. Requirements:

Responsive design: Mobile-first CSS with a collapsible nav menu (hamburger on small screens) and fluid grid-based layouts.

Accessibility: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance  semantic HTML5, ARIA roles, skip-to-content link, proper landmarks, color contrast, focus states, and full keyboard navigation.

Performance: Minified CSS/JS, lazy-loaded scripts, optimized styles, lightweight animations. No frameworks.

SEO readiness: Unique meta titles/descriptions, proper heading structure, canonical links, sitemap placeholder, open graph tags.

Dark mode: Toggle button that persists with localStorage.

Components: Reusable cards, buttons, hero sections, and a styled news article template.

Forms: Contact form with client-side validation (accessible error messages).

Content structure: Build at least 4 pages  index.html (home), about.html, news.html (with article placeholders), and contact.html. Ensure consistent header/footer across pages.

Polish: Smooth hover states, clear typography hierarchy, whitespace balance, consistent branding colors.

Deployment ready: All links must be relative and work offline on any static host. Provide a short README.html summarizing features, structure, and how to deploy.

explain this codebase

Please add a "Photo of the Day" section to the homepage. This section should appear below the main welcome message. It needs to include:



- A placeholder image (you can use an online placeholder service like https://picsum.photos/800/400).

- A brief caption under the image, for example: "The South Lawn of the White House on a sunny afternoon."

- The section should be styled to fit the existing theme and also support dark mode.

- Make the image clickable, and when clicked, it should log a message to the console.
